Title.evidence: Escalation of Care in Deteriorating Ward Patients: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a randomised controlled trial in two NHS Trusts

Participants.evidence: the study included medical, surgical, and trauma patients

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to develop a theoretical understanding of escalation and identify success factors.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the identification of escalation communication phenotypes, measured over 105 hours of observation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 151 escalation events were captured.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Four communication phenotypes were identified: Outcome Focused, Informative, General Concern, and Spontaneous Interaction Escalations.

Funding.evidence: Funded by the National Institute for Health and Care Research.
